metadata.title: Epidemiological and clinical features of the 2019 novel coronavirus outbreak in China
metadata.author: Yang Yang, Qingbin Lu, Mingjin Liu, Yixing Wang, Anran Zhang, Neda Jalali, Natalie Dean, Ira Longini, M. Elizabeth Halloran, Bo Xu, Xiaoai Zhang, Liping Wang, Wei Liu, Liqun Fang
metadata.abstract: Our manuscript was based on surveillance cases of COVID-19 identified before January 26, 2020. As of February 20, 2020, the total number of confirmed cases in mainland China has reached 18 times of the number in our manuscript. While the methods and the main conclusions in our original analyses remain solid, we decided to withdraw this preprint for the time being, and will replace it with a more up-to-date version shortly. Should you have any comments or suggestions, please feel free to contact the corresponding author.

summary: Epidemiological and clinical features of the 2019 novel coronavirus outbreak in China Yang Yang1*, Qing-Bin Lu2, Ming-Jin Liu1, Yi-Xing Wang3, An-Ran Zhang1,3,4, Neda Jalali1, Natalie E.
Elizabeth Halloran5 Bo Xu6, Xiao-Ai Zhang3, Li-Ping Wang7*, Wei Liu3*, Li-Qun Fang3*
State Key Laboratory of Pathogen and Biosecurity, 20 Dong-Da Street, Beijing Institute of Microbiology and Epidemiology, Fengtai District, Beijing, China 100071; Y.
Department of Biostatistics, College of Public Health and Health Professions, and Emerging Pathogens Institute, University of Florida, Gainesville, FL, USA 32611; L.

P. Wang, Division of Infectious Disease, Key Laboratory of Surveillance and Early-warning on Infectious Disease, Chinese Centre for Disease Control and Prevention, Beijing, China 102206 medRxiv preprint doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.02.10.20021675.
The copyright holder for this preprint is the author/funder, who has granted medRxiv a license to display the preprint in perpetuity.
It is made available under a CC-BY-NC-ND 4.0 International license .
The authors' manuscript was based on surveillance cases of COVID-19 identified before January 26, 2020.
As of February 20, 2020, the total number of confirmed cases in mainland China has reached 18 times of the number in the manuscript.

While the methods and the main conclusions in the original analyses remain solid, the authors decided to withdraw this preprint for the time being, and will replace it with a more up-to-date version shortly.
Please do not cite this preprint.
Should you have any comments or suggestions, please feel free to contact the corresponding author, Dr. Liqun Fang.

Introduction: Epidemiological and clinical features of the 2019 novel coronavirus outbreak in China Yang Yang1*, Qing-Bin Lu2, Ming-Jin Liu1, Yi-Xing Wang3, An-Ran Zhang1,3,4, Neda Jalali1, Natalie E.
Elizabeth Halloran5 Bo Xu6, Xiao-Ai Zhang3, Li-Ping Wang7*, Wei Liu3*, Li-Qun Fang3*
Results: State Key Laboratory of Pathogen and Biosecurity, 20 Dong-Da Street, Beijing Institute of Microbiology and Epidemiology, Fengtai District, Beijing, China 100071; Y.
Department of Biostatistics, College of Public Health and Health Professions, and Emerging Pathogens Institute, University of Florida, Gainesville, FL, USA 32611; L.

P. Wang, Division of Infectious Disease, Key Laboratory of Surveillance and Early-warning on Infectious Disease, Chinese Centre for Disease Control and Prevention, Beijing, China 102206 medRxiv preprint doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.02.10.20021675.
The copyright holder for this preprint is the author/funder, who has granted medRxiv a license to display the preprint in perpetuity.
It is made available under a CC-BY-NC-ND 4.0 International license .
The authors' manuscript was based on surveillance cases of COVID-19 identified before January 26, 2020.
As of February 20, 2020, the total number of confirmed cases in mainland China has reached 18 times of the number in the manuscript.
Conclusion: While the methods and the main conclusions in the original analyses remain solid, the authors decided to withdraw this preprint for the time being, and will replace it with a more up-to-date version shortly.
Please do not cite this preprint.
Should you have any comments or suggestions, please feel free to contact the corresponding author, Dr. Liqun Fang.
